Bu məşq xüsusi olaraq aşağıdakı qarın əzələlərinə yönəldilmişdir: düz qarın əzələsi (rectus abdomini), xarici oblique abdominal (oblique externus abdomini) və daxili oblique abdominal əzələ (oblique internus) dəstəkləyən əzələlər budun ön hissəsindəki böyük gluteal əzələlərdir (glutaeus maximus) və rektus femoris.

sixpack-musc.name: Plank
sixpack-musc.information: Qarnınızı yerə qoyun və dirsəklərinizə və ayaq barmaqlarınıza söykənin. Əlləriniz çiyinlərinizin önündə sıxılarkən dirsəklərinizə söykənin. Bədəninizi elə qaldırın ki, yalnız ayaqlarınızın və qollarınızın üstündə dayansın. Aşağı baxın. və belinizi düz tutun.Bu, bütün vücudunuzun başdan dabana düz olması deməkdir, içbükey və ya qabarıq bir arxa çəkinin. Bu mövqedə bir müddət saxlayın. 15 saniyə ilə başlayın və vaxtı tədricən artırın. İstəyə görə qısaca bir çox dəst yerinə yetirin. fasilələr.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Arxa belinizi düz tutmaq vacibdir.
b) Əvvəlcə vəziyyətinizi yoxlayın.
c) Başlayanlar da bu işi ayaq barmaqlarının yerinə dizlərdə edə bilərlər. Bu da asanlaşdırır. etmək.
sixpack-musc.musc: Taxta hərəkəti sözdə mürəkkəb bir məşqdir. Bu, bir anda fərqli əzələlər işləməyiniz deməkdir. Taxta hərəkəti ilə çox sayda vacib əzələ ilə mübarizə aparırsınız. Bunlar düz qarın əzələləridir (qarın rektusu), daxili oblique qarın əzələsi (oblique). Internus abdomini) və xarici oblique qarın əzələsi (oblique exterus abdomini). Ayrıca çiyinlərdə, bel və kalçalarda müxtəlif tarazlayıcı əzələlər işləyir.

sixpack-musc.name: Band Bicycle Crunch
sixpack-musc.information: Kəmərləri ayaqlarınızın ətrafına qoyun. Arxanıza basaraq yerə söykənin. Gövdə əzələlərinizi dartın. Əllərinizi başınızın arxasına gevşetin. Dizlərinizi 45 dərəcə bir açı ilə qaldırın. Ayaqlarınızla velosiped hərəkəti edin. . Həmişə qarşı dizinizi dirsəklə vurmaq üçün bir dönüş edin.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Dərin abseni daima onurğa tərəf çəkərək onurğanı neytral vəziyyətdə saxlayın.
b) Çənəni sinənizə çəkməyin.
c) İdman boyu rahat bir boyun təmin edin.
sixpack-musc.musc: Velosiped idmanı mürəkkəb bir məşqdir. Bu, məşq zamanı fərqli əzələləri hədəf alması deməkdir. Bu məşq əsasən düz qarın (rektus abdominis), daxili oblique abs (oblique internus qarın əzələsi), xarici oblique qarın (oblique external) ibarətdir Əlavə olaraq, müxtəlif stabilizator əzələlər də əməkdaşlıq edir: böyük gluteal əzələlər (glutaeus maximus), hamstrings (budun arxası), rektus femoris və sartorius (hər ikisi də ön bud).

leg-musc.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift
leg-musc.information: Ayaqlarınızı çiyin enindən az tutun və bir ştanq götürün. Avuçlarınız bədəninizə baxır və bunları budlarınızın kənarındakı barbellın üstünə qoyursunuz. Dizlərinizi yüngül bir açı ilə bükün və bu vəziyyətdə olduğundan əmin olun. qaldırarkən bucağı barmaqlığı bədənə yaxın tutun və qollarınızı düz saxlayın.Bu çubuq dizinizin altına düşənə qədər itburnunuzdan əyilərək bədəninizi yuxarıya endirin.
leg-musc.help: a) Dizlərinizi eyni açıda bükün və belinizi düz tutun. Həmişə bədəninizi sakit və nəzarət altında aşağı salın. <hr> b) Bu işi normal Deadlift-dən daha az çəki ilə edin. <hr> c) Texnik Nəzarətə başlamaq üçün yeni başlayanlar əvvəlcə bu məşqləri ağırlıq olmadan daha yaxşı edə bilərlər.
leg-musc.musc: Barbell Roman qaldırma ilə, ayaqlarda və kalçada fərqli əzələlərə toxunulur. Vurğu böyük gluteal əzələlərə (glutaeus maximus) və budların arxasındakı müxtəlif əzələlərə yönəldilir. Daha doğrusu, bu semimembranosus, semitendinosus ilə əlaqəlidir. , və biceps femoris.Bu əzələlər hamstrings hissəsidir.Nəhayət, düzəldici spinae (arxa sedye) də yüngül şəkildə öyrədilmişdir.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Deadlift
leg-musc.information: Qarşınızdakı yerə bir barbell qoyun və ayaqlarınızın çiyin enində bir-birinizlə qarşınızda durun. Dizlərinizi aşağı salın və qarışıq bir tutuşla barterinizi tutana qədər arxa və qollarınızı düz tutun. Bir xurma sizinlə, digər xurma isə sizdən uzaqlaşır.Özünüzü möhkəm tutun və ayağa qalxınca dizlərinizi və budlarınızı uzatın.Hərəkətin ən yüksək nöqtəsində çiyinlərinizi qulaqlarınıza yaxınlaşdırın, sonra sinənizi irəli açın. Çiyinlərinizi aşağı salın, dizlərinizi bükün və ştanqınızı yavaşca endirin, ştanqın yerə toxunmamasından çəkinin.
leg-musc.help: a) Bütün məşq boyu belinizi düz tutun. Konkav və ya qabarıq arxadan çəkinin. <hr> b) Başlanğıcda çox çəki çəkməyin. Əvvəlcə hərəkəti yoxlayın, sonra çəkini yavaşca artırın. <hr> c) İdman edərkən yerə baxmayın., qarşınızdakı iki metrlik yerdə bir nöqtəyə diqqət yetirin
leg-musc.musc: Bu hərəkəti edərkən əsas gluteal əzələlər (glutaeus maximus) və yuxarı ayaqların ön hissəsi (vastus lateralis) nəzərə alınır. Bundan əlavə, müxtəlif dəstəkləyici əzələlər də nəzərə alınır. Yəni biceps femoris (arxa budlar) , semimembranosus (arxa budlar)., semitendinosus (arxa budlar), adduktorlar (arxa budlar) və erektor spina (uzun düz arxa əzələlər). Qısası: Bu, eyni zamanda fərqli əzələləri məşq etdirmək üçün təsirli bir məşqdir.

leg-musc.name: Dumbbell Squat
leg-musc.information: Dumbbelləri götürün və ayaqlarınızın çiyin enində arada durun. Dumbelləri qollarınızı uzadıb ovuclarınızı üzünüzə tərəf qoyun. Yan tərəfdə məşq boyunca divarın bir nöqtəsinə düz baxın. Dizlərinizi büküncəyə qədər. budlarınız döşəmədə üfüqi vəziyyətdədir. İndi ayaqlarınız tamamilə uzandı. yavaşca yenidən qalxın.
leg-musc.help: a) Bu məşq əsnasında irəliyə baxın. <hr> b) Dabanlarınızı yerdən uzaq tutun. Bu vəziyyətdə enməyi dayandırmalısınız. <hr> c) Sükunət hərəkətləri ilə barbell çölə atın. enərkən bacaklarınızı bükməyinizə ehtiyac yoxdur. <hr> d) budlarınızı döşəmədən üfüqi yuxarıya endirməyin.
leg-musc.musc: Bu hərəkət edərkən əsas gluteal əzələləri (glutaeus maximus), yuxarı ayaqların ön hissəsini (femuris rectus) və dördbucaqlıları məşq etdirməkdir. Bu, yuxarı ayaqların əksəriyyətinə yayılan quadriseps bud əzələsidir. Daha konkret olaraq bud budda aşağıdakı əzələləri əhatə edir: vastus intermedius, vastus intermedius və vastus medialis.Dantel çömbəlməsi ilə təlim görmüş digər əzələlər yuxarı ayaqların oynaqlarıdır.Qısası: Bu məşqlə əzələlərin çox hissəsini gərginləşdirirsiniz. ayaqları və kalçaları.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Lunge
leg-musc.information: Tamamilə dik durun. Dəstəyi yuxarı kürəyinizə, boynunuzun altına qoyun. Barmaqlığı çiyin enindən bir az aralı, ovuclarınız özünüzdən uzaq tutun. Bir ayağınızla irəliyə doğru böyük bir addım atın və dayağınızı qoyun. ayaq yerə düz. Ön dizinizi, sonra arxa dizinizi bükün. Bu hərəkət səbəbi ilə cəsəd yerə tərəf batır. Arxa ayaq döşəmədə üfüqi olana qədər enməyi dayandırın. Çəki artıq ayağınızdadır. İndi keçin özünüzü ön ayaqda edin.Məşqi təkrarlayın və bir neçə təkrarlandıqdan sonra ayağı dəyişdirin.
leg-musc.help:
a) Ştanqı boynunuza deyil, boynunuzun altına, arxa üstə yerləşdirməyiniz vacibdir.
b) Bütün məşq zamanı düz irəli baxın.
c) Əmin olun magistral sabit vəziyyətdədir və mümkün qədər az hərəkət edir.
d) Həmişə hər iki ayağınızda eyni yüklə çalışın.
leg-musc.musc: Barbell Lunge hərəkətində fərqli əzələlər, xüsusilə də böyük kalça əzələləri və budun ön hissəsindəki əzələlər işlənir. Glutaeus maximus (böyük gluteal əzələlər), induktor maqnus (böyük bud əzələləri), vastus medialis və vastus lateralis (ön budlar) dəqiq olmalıdır. Adductor brevis və vastus intermedius (budun daxili əzələləri) də örtülüdür. Qısası: Barbell-lunge, bacakların və kalçaların böyük hissələri ilə mübarizə aparan təsirli bir məşqdir.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Step Up
leg-musc.information: Bir skamyada və ya 20-40 santimetr hündürlüyündə sinənizin önündə durun. Ayaqlarınızı yan-yana qoyun və boynunuzun biraz altındakı yuxarı belinizə bir barbell qoyun. Düz baxın və ayağınızı saxlayın düz arxa. İndi bir ayağınızı yerdən qaldırın və bu ayağınızı skamyada saxlayın. ya da sinəyə basın. digər ayağınızı yanınıza qoyun. ilk ayağınızı yenidən hərəkət etdirin və digər ayağını izləyin.
leg-musc.help: a) Ştanqı boynunuza qoymayın, ancaq boynunuzun altından yuxarı arxa tərəfə qoyun. <hr> b) Barbell addımı sakit və bərabər bir tempdə yerinə yetirilməlidir <hr> c) Həmişə bir neçə dəfə təkrarlandıqdan sonra ikinci bir dəsti yerinə yetirin, digər ayağını əvvəlcə divana və ya sinəyə qoyun. <hr> d) Yalnız ayaqlarınızla hərəkət edin və düz arxa bir şəkildə məşq edin. <hr> e) Məşqi daha da çətinləşdirə bilərsiniz. əlavə çəki ilə və ya daha yüksək bir dəzgah və ya sinəyə basaraq.
leg-musc.musc: Barbell addım atma hərəkəti ilə aşağı bədənin böyük bir hissəsini məşq etdirməyə başlamısınız. İdman böyük gluteal əzələləri (glutaeus maximus), yuxarı ayaqların yan əzələlərini (vastus lateralis), yuxarı ayaqların (vastus medialis) və buzovların (gastrocnemius və soleus) ön hissəsi. Kiçik bir bonus olaraq, biceps femoris (arxa bud) kooperativ bir əzələ olaraq da böyüyür.

leg-musc.name: Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise
leg-musc.information: Ayaqlarınızla qalın bir taxta və ya pilləkən kimi bir platformada durun. Ayaqlarınızı platformaya elə qoyun ki, dabanlarınız ayaq barmaqlarınızdan aşağı olsun. Dik durun və dumbbelləri bədəninizlə düz tutun. qollarınız. Ştanq budlarınızın yanındadır. İndi ayaqlarınızın üstündə durun və dabanlarınız qaldırıldı. İndi dabanlarınızı yüksəkliyin altına endirərək özünüzü mümkün qədər aşağı salın.
leg-musc.help:
a) Bu hərəkət əsnasında uzanmaqdan çəkinin. Hərəkət başqa hərəkətlər etmədən sakit və idarəedici bir şəkildə həyata keçirilməlidir.
b) Hərəkət ayaqlardan olmalıdır. Həmişə dizlərinizin və itburnu düzdür.
c) Dumbbell ayağı. Dana qaldırmaq üçün usta, çəkisiz bir nərdivan başlaya bilərsiniz. Sonra əlinizi nərdivan korkuluklarına qoyaraq tarazlaşa bilərsiniz.
leg-musc.musc: Dumbbell Ayaqda Dana qaldırmaqla, buzovlarda ən az altı əzələ istifadə olunur. Bunlar buzov (soleus), uzun kavernöz fleksor (flexor hallucis longus), uzun ayaq fleksoru (flexor digitorum longus), posterior tibial əzələdir. (tibialis posterior). və bazanın (plantaris) altındakı səthi buzov əzələsi (gastrocnemius). Qısası: Dana içindəki bütün vacib əzələlər bu məşqlə idarə olunur.

leg-musc.name: Leg Press
leg-musc.information: Ayaq basma cihazında oturun. Qolları tutun. Arxada uzanın və ayaqlarınızı lövhənin üstünə qoyun. Ayaqlarınız azca bayıra yönəldilib. Ağırlığı biraz qaldırmaq üçün lövhəyə təzyiq edin. Sonra təhlükəsizlik qapılarını buraxın. Plitəni yavaş-yavaş və rahat şəkildə gövdəyə endirin. Ayaqlarınız tamamilə uzanır. Ağırlığı yavaş-yavaş idarəli bir şəkildə başlanğıc mövqeyinə qədər itələyin.
leg-musc.help:
a) Zədələnməmək üçün çəkini idarəli şəkildə azaltmaq vacibdir.
b) Maksimum nəticə əldə etmək üçün çəkini mümkün qədər geniş və yuxarı qaldırmaq vacibdir.
c) Bu məşqə yiyələnmək üçün yeni. Başlayanlar plitəni yalnız seriyanın birinci rübünə yükləyə bilərlər.
leg-musc.musc: Ayaq basması ilə bacaklardakı və kalçadakı fərqli əzələlər öyrədilir. Birincisi, bu məşq dörd başlı və böyük gluteal əzələlərin (glutaeus maximus) məşqinə yönəldilir. Bundan əlavə, fərqli əzələlər intensiv olaraq məşq edilir. yuxarı ayaqların ön və daxili hissələri.Onların qabağı.digus medialis, vastus lateralis və vastus intermedius.Yuxarı ayaqların daxili hissəsinin əzələləri induktor maqnusu, induktor brevies və induktor uzunluğu.

leg-musc.name: Leg Extension
leg-musc.information: Ayaq uzatma cihazında oturun. Dizlərinizin arxasını oturacağın kənarına və diz oynaqlarınıza, qaldırıcı çubuğun yuxarı hissəsini ayaqlarınızın arasına qoyun. Silindrlərin ayağın sonunda olduğundan əmin olun. qaldırıcı çubuq ayaq biləyinizin qabağındadır. İndi ayağınıza söykənin. Düz durana qədər ayaqlarınızı qaldırın. Bədəniniz dik və ayaqlarınız irəli baxır. Yavaş-yavaş (işarələnmiş) çəkini başlanğıc vəziyyətinə gətirin.
leg-musc.help:
a) Ayaqlarınızı çox tez endirməyin və bədəninizin yuxarı hissəsini düz tutun.
b) Ayaqlarınızı tam düz olana qədər maksimum qaldırın. Sonra yavaşca endirin.
c) ayaq biləyi ağırlıqlarının köməyi ilə bu məşq bir cihazdır (yüngül) onsuz edilə bilər.
leg-musc.musc: Bu məşq budların ön hissəsində böyük bir kütlə meydana gətirən quadrisepslərlə mübarizə aparır. Dördbucaqlılar diz oynağını idarə etmək üçün ən vacib funksiyaya sahibdir. Dördbucaqlılar əhəmiyyətli bir əzələ kütləsi yarada bilər, məsələn velosipedçilər, futbolçular. və konki sürənlər. Hamısı ayaq uzadılması ilə. Dörd hissədən ibarətdir. Xüsusilə təlim keçmiş rectus femoris, vastus medialis, vastus lateralis və vastus intermedius ilə əlaqədardır.

leg-musc.name: Lying Leg Curl
leg-musc.information: Yalançı-qıvrım cihazının üstündə uzanın. Dizləriniz yastığın kənarından azca çıxsın və diz oynaqlarınız qaldırıcı çubuğun üst hissəsi ilə bir yerdə olmalıdır. Silindiri qaldırıcı çubuğun arxasına qoyun. ayaq biləklərinizin üstündə. Ayaqlarınızı mümkün qədər uzaqlaşdırın. İndi. yavaş-yavaş başlanğıc vəziyyətinə qayıdın. Bu hərəkət iki və ya üç saniyə davam etməlidir. Vücudunuzun daima bankla təmasda olmasına əmin olun.
leg-musc.help: a) Ağırlığı başlanğıc mövqeyinə çox tez gətirməyin. <hr> b) Hərəkət zamanı kalçalar çox əyilməməlidir. <hr> c) Ayaqları mümkün qədər kalçaya doğru aparın. maksimum təsir üçün.
leg-musc.musc: Üst ayaqların arxasındakı əzələlər bu hərəkətlə xüsusi olaraq öyrədilmişdir. Bu, ikitərəfli bud əzələsi (biceps femoris), yarı əzələ əzələsi (semimembranosus) və yarı əzələ əzələsi (semitendinosus) ilə əlaqədardır. dərzi əzələləri (sartorius) budun xaricindədir və səthi buzov əzələləri (gastrocnemius) yüngül şəkildə öyrədilmişdir.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Squat
leg-musc.information: Ayaqlarınızı çiyin enində ayırın və ayaqlarınızı yüngül bir şəkildə qoyun. Barkonu boynunuzun arxasındakı çiyinlərin üstünə gətirin və ştanqı boynunuzun biraz aşağı hissəsində belinizə qoyun. Barkonu hər iki əlinizlə saxlayın. əllərinizi çiyin enindən bir az daha çox ayırın.Yüzə baxın və aşağı baxmayın.Məşq boyunca düz baxmağa davam edin.Dizlərinizi bükün və yavaş-yavaş yerə enin.Tabanları daima yerdə saxlayın.Toplarınızı hər zaman yerdə saxlayın. budlar yerdən üfüqi vəziyyətdədir.Bundan sonra güclü bir hərəkətlə ayaqlarınızı başlanğıc mövqeyinə qədər uzatın.
leg-musc.help: a) Arxa hissə həmişə Barbell çömçəsi ilə düz olmalıdır. Boş və ya qabarıq arxa zədələnməyə səbəb ola bilər. <hr> b) Dizlər yuxarıya doğru uzanarkən hərəkət etməməli, kiçik barmağın istiqamətini izləməlidirlər. <hr> c) Boyun arxasındakı ştanq onu yerinə qoymayın və topuqları daima yerdə saxlayın.
leg-musc.musc: Barbell çömbəlməsi alt bədəni gücləndirmək üçün daha yaxşı məşqlərdən biridir. Bu məşqdə bir çox əzələ eyni vaxtda məşq edilir. Barbell ağzına əsasən medial, vastus lateralis və vastus medialis daxil olmaqla quadriceps vastus daxildir.) böyük gluteal əzələlərə (glutaeus maximus) fokuslanır. Həm də öyrədilən əzələlər bud budları (bud əzələləri) və bel əzələləridir.

chest-musc.name: Dumbbell Chest Press
chest-musc.information: Sit on the edge of the sofa and let the barbell rest on your knees. Bring the barbell to your shoulders and then lie on your back on the sofa. Hold the dumbbells on either side of your chest with your palms facing your body and your elbows bent. Press the barbell up and stretch your elbows in a small arc. . Keep the barbell on your chest close to each other. Bring the weights slowly to the starting position and pull them to your shoulders when you feel it.
chest-musc.help: a) To master the movement, beginners can start with a low weight at best. <hr> b) Make bow-shaped movements with dumbbells. This effect is achieved by keeping the dumbbells lower than shoulder width and lower than shoulder width. <hr> c) Do not remove the barbell on the floor from the position you lie down before you do the exercise. This may cause injury. <hr> d) Do not let the barbell touch each other.
chest-musc.musc: In the first place, you train the muscles on the sides of the large pectoralis (pectoralis major) and the shoulder blade (anterior deltoid). To lift the barbell, the arms usually rely on the muscles behind the upper arms (triceps brachii). These are the stabilizing muscles. This is the anterior serratus of the shoulder girdle. In the back, these are the broad back muscle (latissimus dorsi) and the monk muscle (trapezius). In the upper arms, this is the ravenbone arm muscle (coracobrachialis).

chest-musc.name: Dumbbell Fly
chest-musc.information: Use a straight fitness bench. Lie on the bench and hold the dumbbells with slightly bent elbows. The dumbbells are now high in the middle of the chest, palms facing each other. Now move the dumbbells to the sides of your chest in a gentle motion. Make sure your elbows remain slightly bent at the same angle. When a pulling sensation occurs in front of your shoulders and chest, stop the movement. Then slowly bring the dumbbells to the starting position. Avoid the barbell contact.
chest-musc.help:
a) Increase the weight slowly. There is a risk of injury when using too much weight as the last position demands a lot of the shoulder joint.
b) The elbows should always remain slightly bent at the same angle as the dumbbell wing.
c) Your arms should always be on your shoulders.
chest-musc.musc: Dumbbell fly is a so-called compound exercise. This means that different muscles work at the same time. The main pectoral muscle (pectoralis major) is mainly trained. Supporting muscles are the deltoid muscle (shoulders), biceps brachii (upper arm), brachioradialis (lower arm lower side) and brachialis (upper arm upper side).

chest-musc.name: Dumbbell Pullover
chest-musc.information: Take a barbell with both hands (hold it against the edge of the barbell). Sit back on a flat fitness bench. Your feet touch the ground and your head is visible at the end. Now push your arms straight up and stretch them over your face. Now gently push the dumbbell over your head. When you feel it pulled against your chest and shoulders, stop the movement. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position.
chest-musc.help:
a) Tighten your abdominal muscles to keep your back straight. Your back should not be empty.
b) Always keep your elbows in the same position: slightly bent and in line with your shoulders.
c) How long you can extend depends on your flexibility. stop the movement when you feel it pulled.
chest-musc.musc: The main chest muscles (pectoralis major) and large back muscles (latissimus dorsi) are predominantly trained by this movement. Various other muscles help to perform the exercise and are therefore immediately addressed. Among the trained supporting muscles, the triceps (lower arms section), flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdominis) and large gluteal muscles (glutaus maximus). In short: This is a very efficient exercise.

chest-musc.name: Barbell Bench Press
chest-musc.information: Lie with your back on a horizontally placed fitness bench. Take the barbell and hold your hands slightly more than shoulder width apart. Hold the barbell with your arms straight and palms just above your chest. Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells to the chest and just above it Exhale and push with a barbell for a long time until your arms are stretched again.
chest-musc.help:
a) Beginners should do this exercise first with a barbell without a weight plate. When you master the movement, you can add extra weight on the barbell.
b) With the bench press, always stand on the fitness bench while your back is straight. This increases the risk of injury.
c) It may be wise for beginners to use an assistant. This also applies to experienced athletes using heavy weights.
d) Always hold the barbell directly on the chest and forward or don't let it wander back.
chest-musc.musc: The barbell bench press focuses primarily on exercising the chest, shoulder and arm muscles. In this exercise, the large chest muscle (depectoralis major), the delta-shaped muscle around the shoulders (anterior deltoid) and the back of the upper arm (triceps brachii) are strengthened. The stabilizing muscles of the cuff and shoulder blade are also trained. In short: bench press is an effective exercise for training different muscles.

chest-musc.name: Cable Crossover
chest-musc.information: Adjust the rollers so that they are slightly above your head. Stand in the middle between the pulleys. Hold your arms with the palms down. Your shoulders turned inward and your hips bent slightly forward. Tighten your pectoral muscles and move your arms down and in. Move your elbows. return to the starting position in a slow (controlled) motion.
chest-musc.help: a) Make gentle movements and avoid pulling back the arms. This may cause the shoulder to protrude from the bowl. <hr> b) This exercise is done with bent elbows. Therefore the pectoral muscles do the job, not the arm muscles. <hr> c ) Cable passage can be made lighter by adjusting the pulleys slightly below shoulder height.
chest-musc.musc: With the passage of the cable, the large pectoralis major muscles are handled. Various support muscles are also used to perform this exercise and are therefore lightly trained. It is related to the abs, and the forearms have flexor carpi ulnaris and extensor carpi radialis.

chest-musc.name: Push Up
chest-musc.information: Lay your stomach on the floor. Place your hands beside your shoulders, hands facing forward. Keeping your body above your toes. Extend your arms to the maximum. Return to the starting position by bending your arms. Slowly lower your body just above the floor.
chest-musc.help:
a) When you come to the push-up position, keep your whole body straight.
b) Do not shrug your shoulders during exercise. This makes your arms less stable.
c) Beginners use this exercise on the knees instead of the toes. In this case, make sure your back is straight and avoid bending your hips. Otherwise it has no effect.
chest-musc.musc: You are exercising a large number of muscles with push-up. The emphasis is mainly on the large chest muscle (pectoralis major), the upper side of the shoulders (anterior anterior), the shoulder girdle (serratus anterior), and the back of the upper arms (triceps brachii). A number of balancing muscles help to perform the exercise. Although they are not intensely trained, they are stimulated. There are different muscles in the forearms (extensor carpi radialis longus, extensor carpi radialis brevis, and extensor carpi ulnaris) .In the inner part of the upper arms this is coracobrachialis. Behind the shoulders, the rotator cuff has stabilizing functions, and on the back, this applies to the rhomboid muscles.

chest-musc.name: Chest Dip
chest-musc.information: Stand between the parallel bars and use the step to make the bars reach waist height. Grasp the bars with both hands. Extend your elbows and bend your knees. Raise your feet from the step. Now lower yourself slowly until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle. Move yourself back to the starting position. push.
chest-musc.help:
a) Exercise can possibly be aggravated by wearing an extra heavy bottom belt.
b) Do not use excessive weight as it can lead to cracks in the large pectoral muscle and triceps.
c) leaning forward to train the pectoral muscles. upright to train the triceps. stop.
chest-musc.musc: Chest bottom movement trains especially the large pectoralis major and the triangular muscle around the shoulders (anterior deltoid). The triceps brachii (hind upper arms) are also intensely trained. In addition, a few supporting muscles are lightly trained. These are the following muscles in the forearms: extensor carpi radialis (outer forearm) and extensor carpi ulnaris.

arm-musc.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
arm-musc.information: Sit on a fitness bench, stool or chair. Place the barbell between your feet. Hold your halter with your palms facing away from you. Raise your arm up until your palm is facing your shoulder. Lower the weight again until your arm is fully extended.
arm-musc.help:
a) This exercise should be done in isolation. This means that the whole body should be quiet during training, except of course the arm you are training
b) Avoid turning or rising from your chest. In this case, then the weight is too heavy.
c) Put your other hand on your thigh for support.
arm-musc.musc: With this isolation exercise, you train three muscles in the targeted manner. In the upper arm, this is mainly the brachialis. This is a flexor muscle that passes over the elbow joint in the front. Dumbbell concentration is also in the inner part of the upper arm under the biceps brachii, which is also largely addressed in flexing. At the end you train the brachioradialis. This is the arm-covered muscle in the forearm. It is located in the upper part of the inner part of the forearms. In addition, some stabilizing muscles work with it. These are the flexor carpi radialis in the arms and the flexor carpi ulnaris. The anterior deltoid shoulder is lightly trained.

arm-musc.name: Barbell Wrist Curl
arm-musc.information: Sit in the center of a fitness bench, lean forward and rest your forearms on the bench. Grasp the hip with your hand a little less than shoulder-width apart. Your palms up. Rest your wrists fully on the fitness bench. You can now turn your wrists to the floor without touching the fitness bench. . Now lower the barbell to the ground and let the bar rotate in the palm towards the fingers.
arm-musc.help:
a) Keep your wrists and elbows at the same height to maintain resistance against wrist bending muscles.
b) Make sure the floor surface is free. If the barbell slips out of your hand, it may slide without touching others.
c) Body parts outside the hands Avoid their movements.
arm-musc.musc: The Barbell wrist curl focuses primarily on training the hand flexors. These are the muscles in the forearms that allow our hands to move. To be precise, you are exercising the flexor carpi radialis, also known as the radial hand fold. This muscle crosses the right side of the forearm. You also train the flexor carpi ulnaris on the left side of the forearm. Finally, the flexor digitorum is also lightly trained. This is a muscle that helps the movement of the fingers.

arm-musc.name: Dumbbell Triceps Extension
arm-musc.information: Stand straight with your legs slightly apart and your feet slightly towards the knee. Take a barbell with both palms on one side of the barbell. Your hands are now V-shaped on the inside of the dumbbell side. Keep your elbows still and bring the barbell behind your head. Move your elbows. finally let it move a little.
arm-musc.help:
a) the dumbbell triceps extension is intended to keep your back straight throughout the exercise. For this, tighten your abs.
b) Lower the weight slowly and maintain a controlled movement.
c) Avoid muscle failure by gaining too much weight. The weight may fall on your neck.
arm-musc.musc: Many athletes tend to forget to train the triceps while their biceps (forearms) are well trained. They both need to pay attention because the triceps do the opposite job of the biceps: the triceps stretches the forearm and the biceps stretches the forearm. The triceps with the barbell triceps extension. In addition to the brachii, you can also train the flexor carpi ulnaris (below the forearms), the deltoid (above the shoulders), the pectoralis major (large pectoral muscles) and the latissimus dorsi (broad back muscles). In short, it is effective to train different muscles at the same time. an exercise.

arm-musc.name: Dumbbell Kickback
arm-musc.information: Lean on your hand and use your knee for stabilization. Place your other foot on the floor next to the sofa. Leave a gap between your leg and the sofa. Now extend your arm at your elbow until it is fully extended and backwards. Lower the weight slowly to the starting position.
arm-musc.help:
a) Do the movement by your arm. Prevent your body from helping to carry your weight.
b) Make sure your elbow is always next to you.
c) Look at a point from a meter in front of you during exercise.
arm-musc.musc: The triceps brachii are specially trained in the dumbbell kickback exercise. In addition, there are three stabilizing muscles that are trained and mean a lot of activity during a workout. The supporting muscles are the posterior deltoid (shoulders) and the extensor carpi ulnaris (inner forearm). The latissimus dorsi (broad back muscle) is also lightly trained.

arm-musc.name: Barbell Biceps Curl
arm-musc.information: Stand on a flat surface with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent. Now lift your barbell towards your upper body until your forearms are vertical. Lower the bar slowly again until your arms are stretched again.
arm-musc.help: a) Bending your biceps should be done with your elbows at your side. <hr> b) The best results are achieved by keeping the body as steady as possible. Therefore, tighten your hip and abdominal muscles to keep your body stable. <hr> c) Speeding up your body When you move too much for you, the barbell becomes overloaded. Your lower back is then loaded and this increases the risk of injury.
arm-musc.musc: Barbell biceps curl movement focuses on training the forearm of the upper arms (biceps brachii), the front of the elbow joint (brachialis), and the lower arm muscle (brachioradialis). In addition, some balancing muscles in the forearm and shoulders are discussed. the diamond-shaped muscle (trapezius) on the top and the delta-shaped muscle (anterior deltoid) in the upper arm. On the inside of the forearms, these are the flexor carpi radialis and the flexor carpi ulnaris.

arm-musc.name: Chest Dip
arm-musc.information: Stand between parallel bars and use them to reach waist height. Grasp the bars with both hands. Extend your elbows and bend your knees. Lift your feet off the step. Now lower yourself slowly until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle. Push yourself back into the starting position.
arm-musc.help:
a) Exercise can possibly be aggravated by wearing an extra heavy bottom belt.
b) Do not use excessive weight as it can lead to cracks in the large pectoral muscle and triceps.
c) leaning forward to train the pectoral muscles. stop.
arm-musc.musc: Chest bottom movement trains especially the large pectoralis major and the triangular muscle around the shoulders (anterior deltoid). The triceps brachii (hind upper arms) are also intensely trained. In addition, a few supporting muscles are lightly trained. These are the following muscles in the forearms: extensor carpi radialis (outer forearm) and extensor carpi ulnaris.

arm-musc.name: Chin Up
arm-musc.information: Even if you work the back muscles at the same time, if your hand position is inside, it will work the forearm more.
arm-musc.help:
a) Keep your abs stiff during training. Otherwise, you will shake your body a lot.
b) To avoid elbow injuries, slowly lower it back to the starting position
arm-musc.musc: The muscles that you actively train with this are listed below. In the back, these are the rhombus muscles and the trapezius shoulder. In the shoulders, these are the delta-shaped muscle (posterior deltoid) and the round arm muscles (main and small main strings). On the upper arms. You train the biceps brachii and brachialis, and the brachioradialis muscle in the lower arms. In addition, some other muscles are lightly trained. In the back, this is the infraspinatus, and in the shoulder, the serratus anterior belt.

arm-musc.name: Cable Triceps Pushdown
arm-musc.information: Place your hands a little less than shoulder-width apart. Stretch out your arms and push the bar into the floor with your elbow at your side. Now move your arms back slowly until your arms almost touch your upper arms.
arm-musc.help:
a) Keep your back straight during exercise. When your back moves with you, the weight is too heavy and the triceps are not trained effectively.
b) Stay close to the cable so you have sufficient endurance throughout the exercise.
c ) Greater stability can be achieved by putting one foot in front of the other.
arm-musc.musc: In the first place, you train the triceps brachii, which is located behind the upper arms. The cable triceps pushdown also offers a good secondary exercise to various other muscles. These are the stabilizing muscles that help to perform the exercise. These are the smooth abdominal muscles (rectus abdomini) and the outer oblique abdominal muscles (oblique externus abdomini). The large pectoralis major (pectoralis major) is also lightly trained. For forearms, hand flexors (flexor carpi radialis and flexor carpi ulnaris) perform a good secondary exercise.

shoulder-musc.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
shoulder-musc.information: Sit on a fitness bench and sit firmly on the vertically positioned backrest. Separate your feet and take a barbell in each hand. Hold the barbell at ear height with the palms facing forward. Now push the dumbbells up until your arms reach the top of your head. Dumbbells. get together on your head, but don't let the barbell touch each other. Bring the barbell slowly to the starting position.
shoulder-musc.help:
a) Avoid a curved back while doing this movement. You can prevent this by tightening your abdominal muscles.
b) Do not allow the dumbbells to touch each other for maximum effect of the exercise.
c) Muscle breakdown when training with heavy weights. It may be helpful to have a lookout to prevent the barbell from falling on your head while you are running.
shoulder-musc.musc: This exercise focuses primarily on training the anterior and lateral deltoid muscles. This is located above the shoulders. Stabilized muscles, biceps brachia (upper arm upper part), triceps brachii (upper arm posterior), serratus anterior and serratus anterior (shoulder girdle. ) and the trapezius (diamond-shaped muscle on the back). In order to raise the dumbbells above the head, the balancing capacity of the trunk is also used. With the dumbbell shoulder press, the abs are also trained.

shoulder-musc.name: Barbell Front Raise
shoulder-musc.information: Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your feet slightly bent. Hold the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Your palms are facing you. Your elbows are slightly bent straight. Now lift your arms forward and up until you reach the height of your shoulders. slowly lower it to the starting position. Prevent the barbell from touching your legs.
shoulder-musc.help:
a) Barbell front raise should be done in a straight position.
b) Protect your body from having to help while exercising.
c) Exercise can also be done on the wall with your back.
d) Straight forward during exercise keep looking.
e) Barbell may not be higher than shoulder height.
shoulder-musc.musc: Barbell front raise initially focuses on the training of the anterior deltoid muscles (shoulders). In addition, various other muscles are also trained. In the shoulders, these are the trapezius and the lateral deltoid. The following muscles in the forearms help to exercise: the extensor carpi radialis and the extensor carpi Ulnaris. Finally, the flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdomini) also has to cope with considerable effort.

shoulder-musc.name: Dumbbell Rear Fly
shoulder-musc.information: Sit at the end of a fitness bench. You can also use a chair or chest. Lean forward and let your body rest on your thighs. Take the dumbbells by your feet. Your palms are turned in. Now raise your hands up and to the side until your elbows are at shoulder level. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position. Do not let the barbell touch your legs.
shoulder-musc.help:
a) Don't let your elbows be higher than shoulder height. This makes no sense for exercise and may cause overload.
b) Do the back of the barbell with slightly bent elbows to avoid injuries.
c ) Prevent dumbbells from touching the legs and do not let them hit your legs.
shoulder-musc.musc: In this so-called compound exercise, different muscles are trained. This means a lot of activity during just one exercise. With the dumbbell rear fly motion, the focus is on the rear deltoid on either side of the upper back, just below the shoulders. In addition, a The knee stabilizer muscles are trained: the trapezius (upper side of the upper back), the rhombus (below the trapezius), the small teeth (the outer edge of the shoulder blades) and the infraspinatus (shoulder blades) in the back and shoulders.Finally, the triceps brachii (under the upper arms). also gets training.

back-musc.name: Barbell Shrug Back
back-musc.information: Stand in front of the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart and straight knees. Take the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Your palms are facing you and your elbows are straight. You stand straight with your arms outstretched. This is your starting position. Now lower your shoulders. Then, raise the barbell to your ears and straight. Slowly bring the barbell to the starting position.
back-musc.help:
a) When training with heavier weights, it is recommended to do the shrug (barbell) with the help of the rack. Inform the weightlifting about your starting position.
b) You do not need to roll your shoulders during the exercise. A straight up and down movement is sufficient. .
c) Always hold the dumbbells tight against your body.
back-musc.musc: The trapezius barbell is trained with a shrug. This is the diamond-shaped muscle on the upper back. The emphasis is on the upper part of the trapezius and the levator scapulae help. Other muscles to be considered are the flexor digit (back of the forearm), The flexor pollicis longus (the back of the forearm) and the erector spinae on the lower back. In short: This is an effective exercise to work different muscles at the same time.

back-musc.name: Dumbbell Pullover
back-musc.information: Take a barbell with both hands (hold it against the edge of the barbell). Sit back on a flat fitness bench. Your feet touch the ground and your head will appear at the end. Now push your arms straight up and stretch them over your face. Now gently push the dumbbell over your head. When you feel it pulled against your chest and shoulders, stop the movement. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position.
back-musc.help:
a) Tighten your abdominal muscles to keep your back straight. Your back should not be empty.
b) Always keep your elbows in the same position: slightly bent and aligned with your shoulders.
c) How long you can stretch depends on your flexibility. stop the movement when you feel it pulled.
back-musc.musc: The main chest muscles (pectoralis major) and large back muscles (latissimus dorsi) are predominantly trained by this movement. The various other muscles help to perform the exercise and are therefore immediately addressed. Among the trained supporting muscles, the triceps (lower arms section), flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdominis) and large gluteal muscles (glutaus maximus). In short: This is a very efficient exercise.

back-musc.name: Dumbbell Rear Fly
back-musc.information: Sit at the end of a fitness bench. You can also use a chair or chest. Lean forward and let your body rest on your thighs. Take the dumbbells by your feet. Your palms are inward. Now raise your hands up and to the side until your elbows are at shoulder level. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position. Do not let the barbell touch your legs.
back-musc.help:
a) Do not allow your elbows to be higher than shoulder height. This makes no sense for exercise and may cause overload.
b) Do the back of the barbell with slightly bent elbows to avoid injury.
c ) Prevent dumbbells from touching the legs and do not let them hit your legs.
back-musc.musc: In this so-called compound exercise, different muscles are trained. This means a lot of activity during just one exercise. With the dumbbell rear fly motion, the focus is on the rear deltoid on either side of the upper back, just below the shoulders. In addition, a The knee stabilizer muscles have been trained: the trapezius (upper side of the upper back), the rhombus (bottom of the trapezius), the small teeth (outer edge of the shoulder blades) and the infraspinatus (shoulder blades) in the back and shoulders.Finally, the triceps brachii (under the upper arms). also gets training.

back-musc.name: Dumbbell Single Arm Row
back-musc.information: Use a flat fitness bench. Place your knee and your support arm hand on the edge of the fitness bench. Make sure the upper body is horizontal on the floor. Place your other foot on the floor next to the sofa. Put your foot aside for stability. Take the dumbbell with your free hand and Hold the palm facing the fitness bench. Now pull the dumbbell up until it reaches your torso. During the movement, your arm moves with you until your elbow is slightly above your waist. Now slowly bring the weight back to the starting position. Do the number of repetitions you want and then change the arm starting position.
back-musc.help:
a) During this exercise, move as little as possible with your body. The movement should come from your arm, not your upper body.
b) When performing the movement, always look at a point on the floor about a meter in front of you.
c) Provide the same training load for both sides.
back-musc.musc: With a barbell single arm row, the back muscles (latissimus dorsi and rhombus muscles), back shoulder muscles (deltoid muscles) and the front of the upper arms (biceps) are trained. In addition, the diamond-shaped muscle (trapezius) in the upper back, upper The muscle on the back of the arms (the main large caterpillars) and the front part on the elbow joint (brachialis) are also trained in this exercise. In short: You train different muscles at the same time in one exercise.

back-musc.name: Barbell-bent-over-row
back-musc.information: The barbell is on the floor in front of you. Go face-to-face with the barbell. Hold the barbell with the palm toward the body and slightly more than shoulder-width apart. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and bend your knees slightly. Keep your back straight. Curl at your hips until your knees are just above the barbell. Pull the barbell so that your elbows are close to the body of the floor. Move the barbell towards your belly but do not touch it. Lower the barbell back to the starting position, but do not touch the floor.
back-musc.help:
a) The barbell on the row should be done with a straight back. Never make your back hollow or round, as this increases the risk of injury.
b) During this exercise, focus your eyes on a point approximately two meters in front of you.
c) Optionally, the barbell changes by moving your palms away from you. With this you attach more importance to training biceps.
back-musc.musc: In this movement, you train the muscles on the back, especially the upper back. This involves the broad back muscle (latissimus dorsi), the triangular muscle around the shoulder (posterior deltoid), the muscle in the shoulder coat (infraspinatus) and the front of the upper arms (biceps). The muscles trained in the lower back are the erector spinae and the hind leg muscles (hamstrings).

back-musc.name: Chin Up
back-musc.information: Grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart. With your palms facing the body. Hang on the bar with slightly bent knees. Hold your head straight. Pull your body gently until your chin is on the bar. Then slowly lower your body to the starting position. With your arms fully in the starting position. lengthens.
back-musc.help:
a) Keep your abs stiff during training. Otherwise you will shake your body a lot.
b) To avoid elbow injuries, slowly lower it back to the starting position
back-musc.musc: The muscles that you actively train with this are listed below. In the back, these are the rhombus muscles and the trapezius shoulder. In the shoulders, these are the delta-shaped muscle (posterior deltoid) and the rounded arm muscles (main and small main strings). On the upper arms. You train the biceps brachii and brachialis, and the brachioradialis muscle in the lower arms. In addition, some other muscles are lightly trained. In the back, this is the infraspinatus, in the shoulder, the serratus anterior belt. And in the arms these are the flexor carpi ulnaris, the triceps brachii and the extensor digitorum.

back-musc.name: Cable Lat Pulldown
back-musc.information: Sit on the bench and keep your back straight. Place your thighs tightly under the rollers. Hold the bar a little more than shoulder-width apart. The palm is closed. Lower the bar under your chin and squeeze your shoulder blades. Slowly lower the weight until your arms are straight again.
back-musc.help:
a) Do not pull the bar behind your head. The tension this creates on the shoulder capsule can cause injuries.
b) Do this exercise with a straight back and do not lean on your back.
c) This exercise will keep your hands less than the shoulder width of the bar. and it can be made lighter by placing the palm facing you.
back-musc.musc: With this movement, you train multiple muscles during a single exercise. The emphasis is on training the large back muscle (latissimus dorsi) and the large round arm muscle (main teres main). In addition, some muscles in the upper arms are effective training. These are biceps brachii (forearm upper arm), brachialis (anterior elbow joint), brachioradialis (limb leg muscle), and posterior deltoid (triangular muscle around the shoulders) Finally, a set of stabilizing muscles work together, including the extensor digitorum. (upper forearm), different muscles in the upper back (trapezius, rhombus, rhombus main), tensor fascia lata (front hips), triceps brachii (hind upper arms), and infraspinatus (base of shoulder blade).

sixpack-musc.name: Bridge Decline
sixpack-musc.information: Lie on your back on the fitness mat. Put your hands next to your body. Now bend your knees against your body and place your feet flat on the floor. Tighten your abdominal and hip muscles and apply pressure to your heels. Lift your hips off the floor and lift your torso up. Make sure that you make a straight line with your body. Stay in this position for 20 to 30 seconds. When your muscles are tired, come back to the ground. Repeat the exercise.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Make the bridge with calm movements. Do not fall too quickly as this can cause injuries.
b) Avoid a concave or convex back. Always maintain a stable straight position by tightening the abdominal and hip muscles.
c ) This exercise can be trained more heavily by putting extra weight on your stomach.
sixpack-musc.musc: The bridge primarily focuses on exercising the abs (abdominal muscles) and lower back muscles. This exercise addresses the following abdominal muscles: flat abdominal muscles (rectus abdominis), internal oblique abdominal muscles (oblique abdominus) and external oblique abdominal muscles ( In the lower back, the split back muscle (multifidus) and the back stretcher (erector spinae) are handled. Finally, the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus) also receive a hard workout.

sixpack-musc.name: Crunch
sixpack-musc.information: Lie with your back on a sports mat. Move your feet toward your hips and lay them flat on the floor. Your legs should now form an imaginary triangle on the floor. Put your hands behind you. Your arms are directed to the side, not forward. Inhale. Now your abs Squeeze your head and lift your head, shoulders and shoulder blades with a gentle movement. Do not go too far from the floor and lower it slowly. Exhale.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Do not make your back hollow or round, but always make sure your back is straight.
b) Movement must come from the stomach. So do not raise your head with your hands behind your neck.
c) Your hands will be on your shoulders The famine is alleviated by running your hands over your chest.
d) Another way to make the exercise lighter is to squeeze your feet under a sofa.
sixpack-musc.musc: Crunch primarily focuses on training the different abdominal muscles. This exercise is specifically aimed at the following abdominal muscles: flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdomini), external oblique abdominal muscle (oblique externus abdomini) and internal oblique abdominal muscle (oblique internus abdomini). the supporting muscles are the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus) and the rectus femoris in the front of the thighs.

sixpack-musc.name: Plank
sixpack-musc.information: Lay your stomach on the floor and lean on your elbows and toes. Lean on your elbows with your hands clenched in front of your shoulders. Raise your body so that it rests only on your toes and forearms. Look down and keep your back straight. This means your whole body should be straight from head to heel. Avoid a concave or convex back. Hold this position for a while. Start with 15 seconds and gradually increase the time. Optionally, perform multiple sets at short intervals.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) It is important to keep the lower back straight.
b) Check your position initially.
c) Beginners can also do this exercise on the knees instead of the toes. This makes it easy to do.
sixpack-musc.musc: Plank movement is a so-called compound exercise. This means that you work different muscles in one go. With the plank movement you mainly fight a large number of important muscles. These are flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdomini), internal oblique abdominal muscle (oblique). Internus abdomini) and external oblique abdominal muscle (oblique exterus abdomini). In addition, various balancing muscles work in the shoulders, lower back and hips.

sixpack-musc.name: Band Bicycle Crunch
sixpack-musc.information: Place the straps around your feet. Lean on the ground by pressing your back on the ground. Tighten your torso muscles. Relax your hands behind your head. Lift your knees at a 45-degree angle. Make a cycling movement with your legs. Always make a turn to hit your opposite knee with the elbow.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Keep the spine in a neutral position by always pulling the deep abs towards the spine.
b) Avoid moving the chin to your chest.
c) Provide a comfortable neck throughout the exercise.
sixpack-musc.musc: Cycling exercise is a compound exercise. This means that it targets different muscles during exercise. This exercise mainly consists of flat abdominal (rectus abdominis), internal oblique abs (oblique internus abdominal muscle), external oblique abdomen (oblique external abdomen). In addition, various stabilizing muscles cooperate: the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus), hamstrings (posterior thigh), rectus femoris and sartorius (both anterior thigh).

shoulder-musc.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
shoulder-musc.information: Sit on a fitness bench and sit firmly on the vertically positioned backrest. Separate your feet and take a barbell in each hand. Hold the barbell at ear height with the palms facing forward. Now push the dumbbells up until your arms reach the top of your head. Dumbbells. get together on your head, but don't let the barbell touch each other. Bring the barbell slowly to the starting position.
shoulder-musc.help:
a) Avoid a curved back while doing this movement. You can prevent this by tightening your abdominal muscles.
b) Do not allow the dumbbells to touch each other for maximum effect of the exercise.
c) Muscle breakdown when training with heavy weights. It may be helpful to have a lookout to prevent the barbell from falling on your head while you are running.
shoulder-musc.musc: This exercise focuses primarily on training the anterior and lateral deltoid muscles. This is located above the shoulders. Stabilized muscles, biceps brachia (upper arm upper part), triceps brachii (upper arm posterior), serratus anterior and serratus anterior (shoulder girdle. ) and the trapezius (diamond-shaped muscle on the back). In order to raise the dumbbells above the head, the balancing capacity of the trunk is also used. With the dumbbell shoulder press, the abs are also trained.

shoulder-musc.name: Barbell Front Raise
shoulder-musc.information: Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and your feet slightly bent. Hold the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Your palms are facing you. Your elbows are slightly bent straight. Now lift your arms forward and up until you reach the height of your shoulders. slowly lower it to the starting position. Prevent the barbell from touching your legs.
shoulder-musc.help:
a) Barbell front raise should be done in a straight position.
b) Protect your body from having to help while exercising.
c) Exercise can also be done on the wall with your back.
d) Straight forward during exercise keep looking.
e) Barbell may not be higher than shoulder height.
shoulder-musc.musc: Barbell front raise initially focuses on the training of the anterior deltoid muscles (shoulders). In addition, various other muscles are also trained. In the shoulders, these are the trapezius and the lateral deltoid. The following muscles in the forearms help to exercise: the extensor carpi radialis and the extensor carpi Ulnaris. Finally, the flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdomini) also has to cope with considerable effort.

shoulder-musc.name: Dumbbell Rear Fly
shoulder-musc.information: Sit at the end of a fitness bench. You can also use a chair or chest. Lean forward and let your body rest on your thighs. Take the dumbbells by your feet. Your palms are inward. Now raise your hands up and to the side until your elbows are at shoulder level. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position. Do not let the barbell touch your legs.
shoulder-musc.help:
a) Do not allow your elbows to be higher than shoulder height. This makes no sense for exercise and may cause overload.
b) Do the back of the barbell with slightly bent elbows to avoid injury.
c ) Prevent dumbbells from touching the legs and do not let them hit your legs.
shoulder-musc.musc: In this so-called compound exercise, different muscles are trained. This means a lot of activity during just one exercise. With the dumbbell rear fly motion, the focus is on the rear deltoid on either side of the upper back, just below the shoulders. In addition, a The knee stabilizer muscles have been trained: the trapezius (upper side of the upper back), the rhombus (bottom of the trapezius), the small teeth (outer edge of the shoulder blades) and the infraspinatus (shoulder blades) in the back and shoulders.Finally, the triceps brachii (under the upper arms). also gets training.

back-musc.name: Barbell Shrug Back
back-musc.information: Stand in front of the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart and straight knees. Take the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Your palms are facing you and your elbows are straight. You stand straight with your arms outstretched. This is your starting position. Now lower your shoulders. Then, raise the barbell to your ears and straight. Slowly bring the barbell to the starting position.
back-musc.help:
a) When training with heavier weights, it is recommended to do the shrug (barbell) with the help of the rack. Inform the weightlifting about your starting position.
b) You do not need to roll your shoulders during the exercise. A straight up and down movement is sufficient. .
c) Always hold the dumbbells tight against your body.
back-musc.musc: The trapezius barbell is trained with a shrug. This is the diamond-shaped muscle on the upper back. The emphasis is on the upper part of the trapezius and the levator scapulae help. Other muscles to be considered are the flexor digit (back of the forearm), The flexor pollicis longus (the back of the forearm) and the erector spinae on the lower back. In short: This is an effective exercise to work different muscles at the same time.

back-musc.name: Dumbbell Pullover
back-musc.information: Take a barbell with both hands (hold it against the edge of the barbell). Sit back on a flat fitness bench. Your feet touch the ground and your head will appear at the end. Now push your arms straight up and stretch them over your face. Now gently push the dumbbell over your head. When you feel it pulled against your chest and shoulders, stop the movement. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position.
back-musc.help:
a) Tighten your abdominal muscles to keep your back straight. Your back should not be empty.
b) Always keep your elbows in the same position: slightly bent and aligned with your shoulders.
c) How long you can stretch depends on your flexibility. stop the movement when you feel it pulled.
back-musc.musc: The main chest muscles (pectoralis major) and large back muscles (latissimus dorsi) are predominantly trained by this movement. The various other muscles help to perform the exercise and are therefore immediately addressed. Among the trained supporting muscles, the triceps (lower arms section), flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdominis) and large gluteal muscles (glutaus maximus). In short: This is a very efficient exercise.

back-musc.name: Dumbbell Rear Fly
back-musc.information: Sit at the end of a fitness bench. You can also use a chair or chest. Lean forward and let your body rest on your thighs. Take the dumbbells by your feet. Your palms are inward. Now raise your hands up and to the side until your elbows are at shoulder level. Bring the weight slowly to the starting position. Do not let the barbell touch your legs.
back-musc.help:
a) Do not allow your elbows to be higher than shoulder height. This makes no sense for exercise and may cause overload.
b) Do the back of the barbell with slightly bent elbows to avoid injury.
c ) Prevent dumbbells from touching the legs and do not let them hit your legs.
back-musc.musc: In this so-called compound exercise, different muscles are trained. This means a lot of activity during just one exercise. With the dumbbell rear fly motion, the focus is on the rear deltoid on either side of the upper back, just below the shoulders. In addition, a The knee stabilizer muscles have been trained: the trapezius (upper side of the upper back), the rhombus (bottom of the trapezius), the small teeth (outer edge of the shoulder blades) and the infraspinatus (shoulder blades) in the back and shoulders.Finally, the triceps brachii (under the upper arms). also gets training.

back-musc.name: Dumbbell Single Arm Row
back-musc.information: Use a flat fitness bench. Place your knee and your support arm hand on the edge of the fitness bench. Make sure the upper body is horizontal on the floor. Place your other foot on the floor next to the sofa. Put your foot aside for stability. Take the dumbbell with your free hand and Hold the palm facing the fitness bench. Now pull the dumbbell up until it reaches your torso. During the movement, your arm moves with you until your elbow is slightly above your waist. Now slowly bring the weight back to the starting position. Do the number of repetitions you want and then change the arm starting position.
back-musc.help:
a) During this exercise, move as little as possible with your body. The movement should come from your arm, not your upper body.
b) When performing the movement, always look at a point on the floor about a meter in front of you.
c) Provide the same training load for both sides.
back-musc.musc: With a barbell single arm row, the back muscles (latissimus dorsi and rhombus muscles), back shoulder muscles (deltoid muscles) and the front of the upper arms (biceps) are trained. In addition, the diamond-shaped muscle (trapezius) in the upper back, upper The muscle on the back of the arms (the main large caterpillars) and the front part on the elbow joint (brachialis) are also trained in this exercise. In short: You train different muscles at the same time in one exercise.

back-musc.name: Barbell-bent-over-row
back-musc.information: The barbell is on the floor in front of you. Go face-to-face with the barbell. Hold the barbell with the palm toward the body and slightly more than shoulder-width apart. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and bend your knees slightly. Keep your back straight. Curl at your hips until your knees are just above the barbell. Pull the barbell so that your elbows are close to the body of the floor. Move the barbell towards your belly but do not touch it. Lower the barbell back to the starting position, but do not touch the floor.
back-musc.help:
a) The barbell on the row should be done with a straight back. Never make your back hollow or round, as this increases the risk of injury.
b) During this exercise, focus your eyes on a point approximately two meters in front of you.
c) Optionally, the barbell changes by moving your palms away from you. With this you attach more importance to training biceps.
back-musc.musc: In this movement, you train the muscles on the back, especially the upper back. This involves the broad back muscle (latissimus dorsi), the triangular muscle around the shoulder (posterior deltoid), the muscle in the shoulder coat (infraspinatus) and the front of the upper arms (biceps). The muscles trained in the lower back are the erector spinae and the hind leg muscles (hamstrings).

back-musc.name: Chin Up
back-musc.information: Grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart. With your palms facing the body. Hang on the bar with slightly bent knees. Hold your head straight. Pull your body gently until your chin is on the bar. Then slowly lower your body to the starting position. With your arms fully in the starting position. lengthens.
back-musc.help:
a) Keep your abs stiff during training. Otherwise you will shake your body a lot.
b) To avoid elbow injuries, slowly lower it back to the starting position
back-musc.musc: The muscles that you actively train with this are listed below. In the back, these are the rhombus muscles and the trapezius shoulder. In the shoulders, these are the delta-shaped muscle (posterior deltoid) and the rounded arm muscles (main and small main strings). On the upper arms. You train the biceps brachii and brachialis, and the brachioradialis muscle in the lower arms. In addition, some other muscles are lightly trained. In the back, this is the infraspinatus, in the shoulder, the serratus anterior belt. And in the arms these are the flexor carpi ulnaris, the triceps brachii and the extensor digitorum.

back-musc.name: Cable Lat Pulldown
back-musc.information: Sit on the bench and keep your back straight. Place your thighs tightly under the rollers. Hold the bar a little more than shoulder-width apart. The palm is closed. Lower the bar under your chin and squeeze your shoulder blades. Slowly lower the weight until your arms are straight again.
back-musc.help:
a) Do not pull the bar behind your head. The tension this creates on the shoulder capsule can cause injuries.
b) Do this exercise with a straight back and do not lean on your back.
c) This exercise will keep your hands less than the shoulder width of the bar. and it can be made lighter by placing the palm facing you.
back-musc.musc: With this movement, you train multiple muscles during a single exercise. The emphasis is on training the large back muscle (latissimus dorsi) and the large round arm muscle (main teres main). In addition, some muscles in the upper arms are effective training. These are biceps brachii (forearm upper arm), brachialis (anterior elbow joint), brachioradialis (limb leg muscle), and posterior deltoid (triangular muscle around the shoulders) Finally, a set of stabilizing muscles work together, including the extensor digitorum. (upper forearm), different muscles in the upper back (trapezius, rhombus, rhombus main), tensor fascia lata (front hips), triceps brachii (hind upper arms), and infraspinatus (base of shoulder blade).

sixpack-musc.name: Bridge Decline
sixpack-musc.information: Lie on your back on the fitness mat. Put your hands next to your body. Now bend your knees against your body and place your feet flat on the floor. Tighten your abdominal and hip muscles and apply pressure to your heels. Lift your hips off the floor and lift your torso up. Make sure that you make a straight line with your body. Stay in this position for 20 to 30 seconds. When your muscles are tired, come back to the ground. Repeat the exercise.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Make the bridge with calm movements. Do not fall too quickly as this can cause injuries.
b) Avoid a concave or convex back. Always maintain a stable straight position by tightening the abdominal and hip muscles.
c ) This exercise can be trained more heavily by putting extra weight on your stomach.
sixpack-musc.musc: The bridge primarily focuses on exercising the abs (abdominal muscles) and lower back muscles. This exercise addresses the following abdominal muscles: flat abdominal muscles (rectus abdominis), internal oblique abdominal muscles (oblique abdominus) and external oblique abdominal muscles ( In the lower back, the split back muscle (multifidus) and the back stretcher (erector spinae) are handled. Finally, the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus) also receive a hard workout.

sixpack-musc.name: Crunch
sixpack-musc.information: Lie with your back on a sports mat. Move your feet toward your hips and lay them flat on the floor. Your legs should now form an imaginary triangle on the floor. Put your hands behind you. Your arms are directed to the side, not forward. Inhale. Now your abs Squeeze your head and lift your head, shoulders and shoulder blades with a gentle movement. Do not go too far from the floor and lower it slowly. Exhale.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Do not make your back hollow or round, but always make sure your back is straight.
b) Movement must come from the stomach. So do not raise your head with your hands behind your neck.
c) Your hands will be on your shoulders The famine is alleviated by running your hands over your chest.
d) Another way to make the exercise lighter is to squeeze your feet under a sofa.
sixpack-musc.musc: Crunch primarily focuses on training the different abdominal muscles. This exercise is specifically aimed at the following abdominal muscles: flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdomini), external oblique abdominal muscle (oblique externus abdomini) and internal oblique abdominal muscle (oblique internus abdomini). the supporting muscles are the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus) and the rectus femoris in the front of the thighs.

sixpack-musc.name: Plank
sixpack-musc.information: Lay your stomach on the floor and lean on your elbows and toes. Lean on your elbows with your hands clenched in front of your shoulders. Raise your body so that it rests only on your toes and forearms. Look down and keep your back straight. This means your whole body should be straight from head to heel. Avoid a concave or convex back. Hold this position for a while. Start with 15 seconds and gradually increase the time. Optionally, perform multiple sets at short intervals.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) It is important to keep the lower back straight.
b) Check your position initially.
c) Beginners can also do this exercise on the knees instead of the toes. This makes it easy to do.
sixpack-musc.musc: Plank movement is a so-called compound exercise. This means that you work different muscles in one go. With the plank movement you mainly fight a large number of important muscles. These are flat abdominal muscle (rectus abdomini), internal oblique abdominal muscle (oblique). Internus abdomini) and external oblique abdominal muscle (oblique exterus abdomini). In addition, various balancing muscles work in the shoulders, lower back and hips.

sixpack-musc.name: Band Bicycle Crunch
sixpack-musc.information: Place the straps around your feet. Lean on the ground by pressing your back on the ground. Tighten your torso muscles. Relax your hands behind your head. Lift your knees at a 45-degree angle. Make a cycling movement with your legs. Always make a turn to hit your opposite knee with the elbow.
sixpack-musc.help:
a) Keep the spine in a neutral position by always pulling the deep abs towards the spine.
b) Avoid moving the chin to your chest.
c) Provide a comfortable neck throughout the exercise.
sixpack-musc.musc: Cycling exercise is a compound exercise. This means that it targets different muscles during exercise. This exercise mainly consists of flat abdominal (rectus abdominis), internal oblique abs (oblique internus abdominal muscle), external oblique abdomen (oblique external abdomen). In addition, various stabilizing muscles cooperate: the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus), hamstrings (posterior thigh), rectus femoris and sartorius (both anterior thigh).

leg-musc.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift
leg-musc.information: Hold your feet less than shoulder-width apart and take a barbell. Your palms are facing your body and you place them on the barbell just outside your thighs. Bend your knees at a slight angle and make sure to hold this angle while raising. Hold the barbell close to the body and keep your arms straight. Lower your upper body now, bending at your hips until the bar is just below your knee.
leg-musc.help: a) Keep your knees bent at the same angle and keep your back straight. Always lower your body calmly and in a controlled manner. <hr> b) Do this exercise with less weight than normal Deadlift. <hr> c) Technique To take control, beginners can first do this exercise better without weights.
leg-musc.musc: With the Barbell Roman deadlift, different muscles in the legs and buttocks are addressed. The emphasis is on the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus) and various muscles behind the thighs. To be precise, it concerns the semimembranosus, semitendinosus, and biceps femoris. These muscles are part of the hamstrings. Finally, the erector spinae (back stretcher) is also lightly trained.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Deadlift
leg-musc.information: Place a barbell on the floor in front of you and stand in front of you with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your knees and keep your back and arms straight until you can grasp your barbell with a mixed grip. One palm is facing you, the other palm is facing away from you. Hold yourself tight and stretch your knees and hips until you stand up. At the highest point of the movement, bring your shoulders closer to your ears, then open your chest forward. Lower your shoulders, bend your knees and lower your barbell slowly. Avoid the barbell from touching the ground.
leg-musc.help: a) Keep your back straight throughout the exercise. Avoid a concave or convex back. <hr> b) Don't take too much weight at the beginning. Check the movement first, then increase the weight slowly. <hr> c) Don't look at the floor while exercising. , focus on a point about two meters on the ground in front of you
leg-musc.musc: While doing this movement, the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus) and the front of the upper legs (vastus lateralis) are considered. In addition, various supporting muscles are considered. Namely, the biceps femoris (back thighs), semimembranosus (back thighs). , semitendinosus (back thighs), adductors (back thighs) and erector spinae (long straight back muscles). In short: This is an effective exercise to train different muscles at the same time.

leg-musc.name: Dumbbell Squat
leg-musc.information: Take the dumbbells and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the dumbbells at your side with your arms outstretched and palms facing you. Look straight ahead at a point on the wall throughout the exercise. Bend your knees until your thighs are horizontal on the floor. Now your legs are fully extended. slowly rise again.
leg-musc.help: a) Keep looking forward during this exercise. <hr> b) Keep your heels off the ground. In this case, you should stop lowering. <hr> c) Do the barbell squat with calm movements. You don't need to bend your legs while descending. <hr > d) Do not lower your thighs higher than the floor horizontal.
leg-musc.musc: This is to train the major gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus), the front of the upper legs (rectus femoris) and the quadriceps while doing this movement. This is the four-headed thigh muscle that spreads over most of the upper legs. More specifically, the thigh includes the following muscles: vastus intermedius, vastus intermedius and vastus medialis. Other muscles trained with the dumbbell squat are the joints of the upper legs. In short: With this exercise, you strain a lot of muscles on the legs and hips.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Lunge
leg-musc.information: Stand fully upright. Place the barbell on your upper back, just below your neck. Hold the barbell a little more than shoulder width apart, with your palms away from you. Take a big step forward with one leg and place your foot flat on the floor. Bend your front knee and then your back knee too. The body is sinking towards the ground due to this movement. Stop lowering until the back leg is horizontal on the floor. The weight is now on your foot. Now pass yourself on the front leg. Repeat the exercise and change the foot after a few repetitions.
leg-musc.help:
a) It is important that you place the barbell under your neck, not just under your neck, on your upper back.
b) Look straight ahead during the entire exercise.
c) Make sure the trunk is in a stable position and move as little as possible.
d) Always work with the same load on both legs.
leg-musc.musc: In the Barbell Lunge movement, different muscles, especially the large hip muscles and the muscles in front of the thigh, are worked. Glutaeus maximus (large gluteal muscles), inductor magnus (large thigh muscles), vastus medialis and vastus lateralis (front thighs) must be precise. Adductor brevis and vastus intermedius (inner thigh muscles) are also discussed. In short: Barbell-lunge is an effective exercise that combats large parts of the legs and buttocks.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Step Up
leg-musc.information: Stand on a bench or in front of your chest that is 20 to 40 centimeters high. Place your feet side by side and place a barbell on your upper back, just below your neck. Look straight ahead and keep your back straight. Now lift one leg off the ground and with this leg on the bench. or step on the chest. Put the other foot next to you. Move your first foot again and follow the other foot.
leg-musc.help:
a) Do not place the barbell against your neck, but just below your neck, on the upper back.
b) The barbell step should be performed at a calm and even pace
c) Always do a second set after several repetitions. put the other leg on the sofa or chest first.
d) Move only with your legs and do the exercise with a straight back.
e) You can make the exercise more difficult with extra weight or by pressing a higher bench or chest.
leg-musc.musc: You have begun to train a large part of the lower body with the barbell-step-up movement. Exercise involves the large gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus), the lateral muscles of the upper legs (vastus lateralis), the front of the upper legs (vastus medialis) and the calves ( gastrocnemius and soleus). As a small bonus, the biceps femoris (back thigh) is also grown as a cooperative muscle.

leg-musc.name: Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise
leg-musc.information: Stand with your feet on a platform such as a thick plank or step. Place your feet on the platform in such a way that your heels are lower than the toes. Stand upright and hold the dumbbells straight across your body with your arms. The barbell is next to your thighs. Now Stand on your toes and your heels are raised. Now lower yourself as much as possible by lowering your heels under the height.
leg-musc.help:
a) Avoid stretching during this movement. Movement should be performed calmly and in a controlled manner, without other movements.
b) Movement should come from the feet. Always make sure that your knees and hips are straight.
c) Dumbbell standing To raise the calf, you can start a master, weightless ladder. Then, you can balance your hand by placing your hand on the ladder railing.
leg-musc.musc: With Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise, no less than six muscles are exercised in the calves. These are calf (soleus), long cavernous flexor (flexor hallucis longus), long foot flexor (flexor digitorum longus), posterior tibial muscle (tibialis posterior). and the superficial calf muscle (gastrocnemius) below the base (plantaris). In short: All important muscles in the calf are handled with this exercise.

leg-musc.name: Leg Press
leg-musc.information: Sit on the Leg Press device. Grasp the arms. Lie back and place your feet on the plate. Your feet are slightly directed outward. Apply pressure to the plate to slightly raise the weight. Then release the safety catches. Lower the plate slowly and comfortably into the body. Your legs are fully extended. Slowly push the weight up to the starting position in a controlled manner.
leg-musc.help:
a) To avoid injury, it is important to reduce the weight in a controlled manner.
b) For maximum results, it is important to move the weight up and down in the widest possible range.
c) New to master this exercise. starters can only download the plate to the first quarter of the series.
leg-musc.musc: With the Leg Press, different muscles in the legs and hips are trained. First, this exercise focuses on the training of the quadriceps and the big gluteal muscles (glutaeus maximus). In addition, the different muscles are intensively trained on the front and inner parts of the upper legs. In front of the thighs. Vastus medialis, vastus lateralis and vastus intermedius. The muscles of the inner part of the upper legs are the inductor magnus, the inductor brevies and the inductor longus.

leg-musc.name: Leg Extension
leg-musc.information: Sit on the leg-extension device. Place the back of your knees on the edge of the seat and your knee joints, the upper part of the lift bar between your legs. Make sure the rollers at the end of the lift bar are just in front of your ankles. Now lean on your leg. Lift your legs until you stand straight. Your body is standing upright and your feet are facing forward. Slowly bring the (marked) weight to the starting position.
leg-musc.help:
a) Do not lower your legs too quickly and keep your upper body straight.
b) Raise your legs to the maximum until they are completely straight. Then lower them slowly.
c) With the help of ankle weights, this exercise is a device can be performed (lightly) without it.
leg-musc.musc: This exercise combats the quadriceps that form a large mass in the front of the thighs. The quadriceps has the most important function to control the knee joint. The quadriceps can form a significant muscle mass, for example cyclists, soccer players and skaters. All with leg extension. It consists of four parts. It is particularly concerned with trained rectus femoris, vastus medialis, vastus lateralis and vastus intermedius.

leg-musc.name: Lying Leg Curl
leg-musc.information: Lie on top of the lying-leg-curl device. Your knees should protrude slightly from the edge of the pillow and your knee joints should be flush with the top of the lift bar. Place the roller behind the lift bar just above your ankles. Move your legs as far as possible to your hips. Now. slowly return to the starting position. This movement should last two or three seconds. Make sure your body always stays in contact with the bank.
leg-musc.help:
a) Do not bring the weight to the starting position too quickly.
b) The hips should not bend too much during the movement.
c) Move the legs towards the hips as much as possible for maximum effect.
leg-musc.musc: The muscles behind the upper legs are specially trained by this movement. It concerns the bilateral thigh muscle (biceps femoris), the semi-muscular muscle (semimembranosus) and the semi-muscular muscle (semitendinosus). In addition, the tailor muscles (sartorius) are outside the thigh. And the superficial calf muscles (gastrocnemius) are lightly trained.

leg-musc.name: Barbell Squat
leg-musc.information: Spread your feet shoulder-width apart and place your feet lightly. Bring the barbell over the shoulders behind your neck and let the barbell rest on your back, just below your neck. Hold the barbell with both hands. Place your hands slightly more than shoulder-width apart. Look straight ahead and Do not look down. Keep looking straight ahead throughout the exercise. Bend your knees and lower yourself slowly.
